relation: Displays all ATM PVCs and traffic information.
Displays all ATM PVCs and SVCs and traffic information.
Displays the statistics for all VPs on an interface or for a specific VP.
Displays configuration information about drop-and-insert connections that have been configured on a router.
Displays statistics about PVCs for Frame Relay interfaces.
Displays statistics for all interfaces configured on the router or access server.
Displays the current state of Layer 2 sessions and protocol information about L2TP control channels.
Displays information about AToM VCs that have been enabled to route Layer 2 packets on a router.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Multiprotocol Label Switching Command Reference - show mpls oam echo statistics through switching tlv [Support] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description [summary] statistics echo oam mpls show To display statistics about Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) Operation, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) echo request packets, use the show mpls oam echo statistics command in privileged EXEC mode. show mpls oam echo statistics switching tlv switching-point status redundancy status protocol notification static status control-plane route-watch status (pseudowire class) spanning-tree mst configuration spanning-tree mode source template type pseudowire snmp-server host snmp-server group snmp-server enable traps mpls vpn snmp-server enable traps mpls traffic-eng snmp-server enable traps mpls rfc vpn snmp-server enable traps mpls rfc ldp snmp-server enable traps mpls p2mp-traffic-eng snmp-server enable traps mpls ldp snmp-server enable traps (MPLS) snmp-server community snmp mib mpls vpn signaling protocol shutdown (mpls) show xtagatm vc show xtagatm cross-connect show xtagatm cos-bandwidth-allocation show xconnect show vrf show vfi show tech-support mpls show spanning-tree mst show
textAfterTable: This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(31)SB2. 12.2(33)SXI This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXI. Usage Guidelines You can use theshow mpls oam echo statistics command to display the following: Currently configured TLV version for MPLS OAM operations. Return code distribution among the received MPLS echo reply packets. Statistics of sent and received MPLS echo packets, and counts of incomplete packet dispatches and timed out MPLS echo requests. If you enter the summary keyword, the Echo Reply count shows all the echo reply packets, regardless of whether they are valid responses to a sent request packet. Therefore, the number of return codes will not match the number of echo reply packets received. Examples The following example displays sample detailed output when the summary keyword is not specified:  Router# show mpls oam echo statistics  Cisco TLV version: RFC 4379 Compliant Return code distribution: !--Success (3) - 5 B--Unlabeled output interface (9) - 0 D--DS map
